# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Below is the Julia program according to your task:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(replace(strip(col), " ", "_")), "-", "_") 
end

println(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs: my_column
```
This code defines a function `clean_column` that first strips the input string from leading and trailing whitespaces, then replaces any spaces with underscores and finally makes everything lowercase. Any hyphens are also converted to underscores. The result is returned by the function which is printed out when called with "My Column".
